result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M. Mann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas M. Mann

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Thomas M. Mann appeared with Attorney Thomas Mulligan II.  Attorney Angeline E Winton appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances. State moves to amend count 1 to a county ordiance, removing the domestic abuse. Motion is granted. Def. pleas guilty.  Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. $299.00  60 DTP
Status conference on February 27, 2017 at 09:15 am.

Defendant, Thomas M. Mann appeared with Attorney Thomas Mulligan II.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.  Bail will continue.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

$500 SB, no contact w/Michelle Mann; no alcohol, not to consume/possess any controlled substances unless prescribed by lic'd doctor; not to operate a motor vehicle w/o valid permit; return date 12/21 at 10 a.m.
